intro: Maxillaria guareimensis, commonly known as the Guareí Mountain orchid, is a species of orchid native to Brazil. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its terrestrial growth habit. The plant features a pseudobulb with a single leaf and produces inflorescences with several flowers. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink with a distinctive yellow lip. Maxillaria guareimensis is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome.
